title: What if Wakanda ran out of vibranium? - Quora

response.answer_text: This could certainly happen. In the main Marvel Comics universe, the meteor that formed the basis of the Great Mound had almost completely been mined out by the time of Wakanda’s war with Latveria (published in Doomwar, 2010). This isn’t to say that the meteor was small, but rather that Wakanda had gotten extremely good at mining and processing it, transferring all the Vibranium into a vault that held 10,000 tons. It was this vault that was Victor Von Doom’s true goal for invading Wakanda.  Doom is apparently the only genius who knows how to mystically charge Vibranium, possibly because his mask is based off a Vibranium relic given to his Romani ancestors generations ago. To keep him from using this ultimate power, T’Challa destroys all the processed Vibranium in the entire world, rendering it inert, basically turning it into another form of metal that has no special properties.  So what will become of Wakanda? Reed Richards worries that T’Challa has destroyed Wakanda’s economy, Victor Von Doom says he’s destroyed Wakanda’s people.  Shuri, in the right panel, believes he’s saved Wakanda instead. Why? T’Challa chose to destroy the Vibranium in part because he believed that Wakanda had grown too dependent on it, but that Wakanda can be more than Vibranium.  What other resources does Wakanda have? For one thing, its people, a culture and civilization that have thrived and advanced in isolation for centuries, without the devastation wrought by outside invaders and colonizers. In the 20th century, generations of Wakandans have visited the outside world and brought back knowledge and technology as well. T’Challa and the Wakandan throne are financial powerhouses with investments around the globe, numerous patents, etc—many of these patents might depend on Vibranium, of course, but the minds of the inventors and business people and artists of Wakanda do not have to. As David Maynard's answer suggests, Shuri could get interested in using Adamantium resins to do work with an entirely different super-metal! Finally, there’s the land itself: Wakanda is small, but consists of more than the Great Mound. Because Wakanda has tried to remain ecologically sound and sustainable, they’ve continued to practice traditional agriculture, fisheries, and ways of life alongside technological development fueled by Vibranium. None of that was lost when Vibranium was neutralized. In recent years, the Marvel comics universe was shattered and re-assembled during the latest Secret Wars event. In its wake, Wakanda was restored to a previous state, and Vibranium is plentiful once more. Still, the lessons learned in the period in-between were not forgotten: Wakanda is more than just the Black Panther, and Wakanda is more than Vibranium.

Let me nip this in the bud. THAT IS NOT POSSIBLE. A giant meteor fell there as explained in Black Panther. (If you haven’t watched it yet I suggest you do. It will answer this question in the first ten minutes of the movie) The entire ground and miles and miles below are all made of vibranium. And if there was any chance of running out, T’Challa would have already ordered it to be conserved.
